DataElement.preferredName: Exposure as Collected Domain Dose Interruption Reason
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The reason that specifies why the dose was interrupted.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Exposure as Collected Domain Dose Interruption Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._A time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected.

Concepts.definition: This interventions domain model reflects protocol-specified study treatment administrations, as collected.

Property.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time._A time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
A time interval during which there is a temporary cessation of something.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._Any unfavorable or unintended disease, sign, or symptom (including an abnormal laboratory finding) that is temporally associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, and that may or may not be considered related to the medical treatment or procedure. Such events can be related to the intervention, dose, route of administration, patient, or caused by an interaction with another drug(s) or procedure(s)._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._Specified quantity of a medicine, to be taken at one time or at stated intervals. [ISO 11615:2012 Health Informatics]_Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.

Concepts.definition: Inflammation of the mucous membranes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.: The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.

Concepts.definition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.
The breakdown product of creatine, a constituent of muscle tissue, that is excreted by the kidney and whose serum level is used to evaluate kidney function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.: The determination of the number of platelets in a blood sample, usually expressed as platelets per cubic millimeter (cmm) of whole blood.

Concepts.definition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.
The determination of the number of platelets in a biospecimen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The outcome of a laboratory test.: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.

Concepts.definition: The outcome of a laboratory test.
Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Elevated; raised or increased.: A large organ located in the upper abdomen. The liver cleanses the blood and aids in digestion by secreting bile.: A protein that speeds up chemical reactions in the body.

Concepts.definition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
Molecules that catalyze a chemical reaction. They are usually proteins, although catalytic RNA and DNA molecules have been identified.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2023.3.7 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0002119. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents and their multiplication, as well as the reaction by the host to these organisms and/or toxins that the organisms produce.

Concepts.definition: The invasion of an organism's body tissues by disease-causing agents and their multiplication, as well as the reaction by the host to these organisms and/or toxins that the organisms produce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Of or pertaining to the kidney.: Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.

Concepts.definition: Of or pertaining to the kidney.
Disturbance, impairment or abnormality of function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.: Fats composed of three fatty acid chains linked to a glycerol molecule.

Concepts.definition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.
Fats composed of three fatty acid chains linked to a glycerol molecule.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.: The bilirubin is bound to glucuronide to form conjugated bilirubin (direct bilirubin). Direct Bilirubin measurement is accomplished by a colorimetric method. Direct Bilirubin in biological fluids reacts with sulfanilic acid at acidic pH to produce a red colored complex. The optical density of produced color has a direct relationship with Direct Bilirubin concentration in the solution.

Concepts.definition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.

The bilirubin is bound to glucuronide to form conjugated bilirubin (direct bilirubin). Direct Bilirubin measurement is accomplished by a colorimetric method. Direct Bilirubin in biological fluids reacts with sulfanilic acid at acidic pH to produce a red colored complex. The optical density of produced color has a direct relationship with Direct Bilirubin concentration in the solution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.: A quantitative measurement of alanine aminotransferase present in a sample.

Concepts.definition: Raised or increased above normal levels or limits.
A quantitative measurement of alanine aminotransferase present in a sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.: The real number of white blood cells (WBC) that are neutrophils. It is derived by multiplying the WBC count by the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count. The normal range for ANC is 1.5 to 8.0 (1,500 to 8,000/mm3).

Concepts.definition: A minimum level or position or degree; less than normal in degree, intensity or amount.

The real number of white blood cells (WBC) that are neutrophils. It is derived by multiplying the WBC count by the percent of neutrophils in the differential WBC count. The normal range for ANC is 1.5 to 8.0 (1,500 to 8,000/mm3).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A lower than average level of platelets in a sample.

Concepts.definition: A lower than average level of platelets in a sample.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

Concepts.definition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.
Time during which some action is awaited; inactivity resulting in something being put off until a later time; the state of being slower or later.
